isis.stitle: TSI 98-12-05 - 1. Late 1997 Model Year Component Changes for the International® T 444E Engine

subjectgroup.subject: 1. Late 1997 Model Year Component Changes for the International® T 444E Engine
2. 1998 Model Year Component Changes for the International® T 444E Engine

geninfo.para: Significant changes were incorporated for the T 444E for late 1997 and the new 1998 model year. The following statements summarize the new engine component modifications:

partsinfo.para: 1. Late 1997 Model Year Component Changes:( Engine Serial No. 634234 to 661894)

The Navistar ECM has incorporated the previous electronic control module (ECM), injector drive module (IDM), and vehicle personality module (VPM) into a single electronic module (Figure 1) (Module P/N 1807349C4). By replacing the three-box control system, the Navistar ECM allows greater reliability and improved accessibility. The faster processing speed and enhanced system memory provide compliance with stringent 1998 emission regulations. In addition, the more powerful micro-processor and increased memory will allow for the integration of future engine control advances and other technologies. Refer to TSI-97-12-26 for further detailed description on the Navistar ECM.
The Navistar ECM is mounted (Support P/N 1825950C91) on the engine with vibration isolating mounts for protection from engine vibration.
An oil fill tube extension (P/N 1830971C91 for all except 3600 Bus) has been added to elevate the oil fill access and fill cap location to a convenient level behind the Navistar ECM.
A new heavy duty glow plug relay (P/N 1825908C2) will help improve reliability.
A new engine electrical harness (P/N 1807418C94) provides compatibility with the Navistar ECM.

partsinfo.para: 2. Late 1997 Model Year Component Changes and 1998 Model Year Component Changes (Engine Serial No. 661895 and Above).

note.para: The following parts changes were incorporated in 1998

partsinfo.para: Increased radial thickness and revised material specifications (Refer to Table 1 below for Ring Set Service Part Numbers)

table.title: Piston Ring Sets (Each set includes one top, intermediate and compression ring)

partsinfo.para: The intermediate compression ring groove depth is greater to match the increased radial thickness of the new intermediate ring (Refer to Table 2below for piston package service part numbers).

table.title: Piston Packages (Each package includes one piston, three rings, piston pin, and two retaining rings)

partsinfo.para: The TP38 turbocharger assemblies with and without exhaust back pressure device (EBPD) are replaced by GTP38 models (Production P/N 1830999C91, with EBPD) (Production P/N 1831000C91, without EBPD). The GTP38 ( Figure 2) has turbo-to-pedestal bolts inserted downward from the turbo into the pedestal instead of upward from the pedestal into the turbo. Turbocharger can now be serviced without removing pedestal. The turbine inlet has a round clamped flange instead of a square bolted flange to connect it to the exhaust adapter.

figure.caption: Figure 2. New GTP38 Model Turbocharger With Pedestal

partsinfo.para: The exhaust inlet adapter (P/N 1826618C91) has a round flange and uses a V-band clamp (P/N 1824400C1) instead of the previous bolts, nuts and gasket.

The engine wiring harness (P/N 1831226C91) has been redesigned to improve routing and provide connections compatible with the new 1998 components. The two separate leads to the under-valve-cover harness for each cylinder bank are replaced by one lead per bank. The breakout location and connector type for the EBPD solenoid are revised to match the new solenoid connector in the new 1998 (model GTP38) turbocharger assembly.
The two separate connectors from the Under-Valve-Cover (UVC) wiring harness for each cylinder bank are replaced by one connector per bank (UVC Harness P/N 1830844C92) (Figure 3).

figure.caption: Figure 3. New Under-Valve-Cover Wiring Harness (Single 9-Pin Connector)

partsinfo.para: The two 5-pin pass-through connectors (between the engine wiring harness and the under-valve-cover harness) are replaced by a single 9-pin connector (Figure 4) valve cover gasket (P/N 1826703C1).

figure.caption: Figure 4. New Valve Cover Gasket With Single 9-Pin (UVC Harness) Connector

partsinfo.para: The mounting boss for the EBPD sensor tube fitting ( P/N 1822713C1) at the front of the manifold is machined deeper. This provides more clearance between the fitting and nearby components for ease of assembly.
The tube (P/N 1831224C1) is revised to match the increased connector depth in the exhaust manifold and to improve assembly clearance in this area.

The high pressure hydraulic hoses (Right Bank, P/N 1831289C1) (Left Bank, P/N 1831130C1) are revised with quick-connect fittings replacing the previous 37° flared-tube fittings for ease of assembly. The related cylinder head fittings (type and location) and the hose routing is also changed (Figure 5).

figure.caption: Figure 5. High Pressure Hydraulic Hose Assembly With Quick-Connect Fittings

partsinfo.para: The high pressure hydraulic pump (P/N 1830857C91) is revised with quick-connect fittings to match the hose fittings.

para.emph: FUEL HOSE ASSEMBLY (REGULATOR TO LEFT BANK)

partsinfo.para: The pressure regulator to left bank fuel hose (P/N 1831309C1) is revised to enable rerouting between the quick-connect fittings near the high pressure hydraulic pump.
To comply with emission standards, the California engines use an exhaust catalyst assembly integral with the muffler.
